title: Vast Forest Coverage
description: In 2022, Suriname had an impressive 94.52% of its land area covered by forests, making it one of the most forested countries in the world.

title: High External Debt Burden
description: As of 2023, Suriname's external debt stood at 84.36% of its Gross National Income, indicating a significant financial burden.

title: Lengthy Process for Electrical Connection
description: In 2018, it took an average of 262.3 days to obtain an electrical connection in Suriname, one of the longest durations globally.

title: High Rate of Female Children Out of School
description: In 2023, 82.81% of female children of primary school age were out of school in Suriname, highlighting a significant educational challenge.

title: Low Progression to Secondary School for Males
description: In 2017, only 59.94% of male students progressed to secondary school, indicating a need for improved educational pathways.

title: Low Exclusive Breastfeeding Rates
description: In 2018, only 8.92% of children under 6 months were exclusively breastfed, suggesting a need for increased awareness and support for breastfeeding.

title: Gender Imbalance in Secondary Education
description: In 2015, 61.25% of secondary education pupils were female, indicating a gender imbalance in school enrollment.

title: Limited Agricultural Land
description: In 2022, only 0.45% of Suriname's land area was used for agriculture, reflecting limited agricultural development.
